author: bergmeister
body:
# PR Summary

Add launchSettings.json for better out of box experience when using Visual Studio and up minimum Visual Studio version to 16 as .Net Core 3 requires this as a minimum. Launching from the `bin` (instead of publish folder) does not work any more, hence the configuration.
Now one can just use `Ctrl+F5` to launch `pwsh.exe` from Visual Studio and one can then attach after that. The VS console has some known limitations (Unicode characters are not displayed for example) and at startup there are some binding exceptions that are thrown, therefore I would not recommend doing a straight `F5` at the moment but I hope this will get better with .Net Core and VS becoming more mature (at the moment one HAS to use the preview of Visual Studio for .Net Core 3)

Fixes #9810
